intro: Mnemion agreste, commonly known as the wild nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, featuring hairy stems and opposite leaves. Its flowers are usually white or purple, and it produces small, berry-like fruits that are toxic to humans and animals. Due to its toxic properties, it is often considered a weed in agricultural settings.
